parameters.text:
=Imagine you are a employee at a insurance company in the customer support and you are chatting with a customer. You get the following message of the customer:

({{ $json.text }})
{{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.text }}

Evaluate the information you got from the customer. Use the memory which contains the previous answeres to check if it contains the PolicyID. The PolicyID has a Prefix "POL-". The user can write it with or without the Prefix, but we need it without.

The following steps need to be done in that order to continue:
First you need the PolicyID, if you dont please only Output "PolicyID".

If you know the PolicyID and the customer want to change his address please Output in JSON Format like this: 

{
  "PolicyID": "POLICY_ID_HERE",
  "Function": "ChangeAddress"
}

If you know the PolicyID and the customer want to claim a Policy, please Output in JSON Format like this: 

{
  "PolicyID": "POLICY_ID_HERE",
  "Function": "ClaimPolicy"
}

If you receive an emoty json file ask the user to use a valid policy id, customer id or name.
=Thank you very much for your answere, but we couldn't find your policy-Number POL-{{ $('JSON to Variables').item.json.PolicyID }} in our Database. Please write it again.

=Imagine you are a employee at a insurance company in the customer support and you are chatting with a customer. You get the following message of the customer:

({{ $json.text }})
{{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.text }}

You need the Adress of the customer. If the message or the previous chat contains a possbile Adress, then please output a JSON in the following Format:

If you know the PolicyID and the customer want to change his address please Output in JSON Format like this: 

{
  "Street": "Street",
  "City": "City",
  "PostalCode": "PostalCode",
}

If you cant find anything, please Output "NoAddress"

=Thank you very much for supplying your PolicyID with the number POL-{{ $('JSON to Variables').item.json.PolicyID }}. We found the following Policy Typ: {{ $('Search records').item.json['Policy Type'] }}.

=You are an assistant working at an insurance company.
You must check in Airtable if the given PolicyID exists in the table "Policies".
If it exists, you need to output the information received as a json to be used by the next model
else do not output anything

=You are an insurance employee. You are receiving information from a client about an incident that just happened. You need to update the columns in the table at the voices "Incident Type" and "Description"

After that you have to send a message to the user of what you just added

for the datetime fields just use the current date and hour
We couldn't find that policy ID in our database. Please provide your policy ID again.

nodes.name: Ask again for the policy ID
